description: a unique generated communication UUID (PK)
name: communication_id
datetime
description: the timestamp at which the communication should be sent
the systems code which sent the message (e.g.: 'NEWSLETTER', 'E-SHOP', ...)
name: sending_sys_cd

description: a unique generated communication UUID (PK) which could be the same for different receipients
name: message_id
thread_id
description: the id of the communication thread (should refer to a prior communication_id or message_id which is the root of the thread)

name: thread_type
description: the type of the communication thread (typically 'message' of 'communication', by default is is considered as a 'communication' thread)

name: thread_name
description: the name of the communication thread

fields.name: id
fields.description: the unique id of the content as provided in doc_content

fields.name: type
fields.description: the type of content as provided in doc_content: 'blog', 'magazin', 'page', ...

fields.name: language
fields.description: the language of the communication

fields.name: title
fields.description: the title of the content

fields.name: short_description
fields.description: the short description of the content

fields.name: description
fields.description: the description of the content
the parent contents related to this content (e.g.: rating of themost helpful customer review / comments)
fields.name: parent_content_ids

fields.description: connections to products
fields.name: products

fields.description: relations to other contents
fields.name: contents

fields.description: the topics of the content
fields.name: topics

fields.description: the brands of the content
fields.name: brands

fields.description: the suppliers of the content
fields.name: suppliers

fields.description: the categories of the content
fields.name: categories

fields.description: the images of the content
fields.name: images

fields.description: the link of the content
fields.name: link

fields.description: the tags of the product line, e.g.: [STRUCT('tag', 'hello world', [STRUCT('de', 'hello world')])]
fields.name: tags

fields.description: the labels of the content, e.g.: [STRUCT('symbol', 'helpful', 'very', [STRUCT('de', 'sehr hilfreich')])]
fields.name: labels

fields.name: widgets

description: information about the content of the communication, typically only provided for the 'sent' event, as the other events should refer to the same message_id and persona_id / email so no need to indicate the content every time, only for sent
name: contents

fields.name: sessionId
fields.description: indicates if a specific sessionId must be provided, typically it is not indicated and you should set it with the value of the cems cookie if you have one

fields.name: profileId
fields.description: indicates if a specific profileId must be provided, typically it is not indicated and you should set it with the value of the cemv cookie if you have one

fields.name: customerId
fields.description: indicates if a specific customerId must be provided, typically it is not indicated and you should use the user account persona_id

fields.name: widget
fields.description: indicates the name of your configured widget

fields.name: language
fields.description: the language

fields.name: hitCount
fields.description: the number of hit to be returned per page

fields.name: offset
fields.description: the offset to be requested, by default 0

fields.name: groupBy
fields.description: the group by field, by default 'products_group_id'
The list of fields that should be returned for each bx-hit in the response
fields.name: returnFields

fields.description: The list of filters to apply in the request
fields.name: filters

fields.description: The list of facets to apply in the request
fields.name: facets

fields.description: The list of sorts to apply in the request
fields.name: sort

fields.description: The list of items to apply in the request
fields.name: items
orFilters
fields.description: if the filters should be applied as and or as or
The list of fields that should be returned for each bx-hit in the response
fields.name: parameters
